questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "FOUNDATION LEVEL : SEMESTER II: ENGLISH II (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "FOUNDATION LEVEL : SEMESTER II: ENGLISH II (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: Read the following exchange and answer the given subquestions.  Mr. A: Welcome to our company.  Mr. B: I am glad for the chance to be interviewed.  Mr. A: What specific job are you applying for?  Mr. B: I am an electrical engineer (double E) and I would like to try to get the job you advertised on the internet last week. Mr. A: I see from your resume that you are very experienced. Mr. B: Yes, I've worked as an electrical engineer for 10 years now. But I think it is a good career move to join your company. Mr. A: Why did you leave your former company?  Mr. B: I left the company for better career opportunities. Mr. A: Okay. Mr. B: So you’ll give me the job? Mr. A: Yes, but for the first three months you will be on probation with half-pay. After that you will be a full employee of the company. Do you have any more questions? Mr. B: What is the salary?  Mr. A: 50k per year Mr. B: Sounds good. When do I start? Mr. A: Report to the engineering dept. on Monday at 9:30 am. Mr. B: Great, thank you. Mr. A: I look forward to working with you.

Mr. A: 50k per year Mr. B: Sounds good. When do I start? Mr. A: Report to the engineering dept. on Monday at 9:30 am. Mr. B: Great, thank you. Mr. A: I look forward to working with you.

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct option.  What is the meaning of ‘probation’ ?
question_texts: Choose the correct option.  What is the meaning of ‘probation’ ?

options.option_text: It means the act or instance of employing someone or something.
It means the trial period that you serve as a new employee in an organization.
It means a binding agreement between two or more persons.
It refers to the practice of working at a secondary job outside normal businesshours.

questions.question_text_1: Fill in the blanks with appropriate options for the given subquestions  After the exam, Raghu told us that the questions were really (1)_____, but it took much (2)_____ to complete the exam than usual. Nitin didn't share the same opinion - he found it to be the (3)_____ exam among them all. He felt that the questions were not (4)_____ and that the misprint in the question paper should have been corrected much (5)_____.
question_texts: Fill in the blanks with appropriate options for the given subquestions  After the exam, Raghu told us that the questions were really (1)_____, but it took much (2)_____ to complete the exam than usual. He felt that the questions were not (4)_____ and that the misprint in the question paper should have been corrected much (5)_____.
